question: A team admin is asked to provide a short presentation on the use and benefit of Microsoft Cloud App Security (now known as Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps). Which of the pillars of Microsoft Cloud App Security is responsible for identifying and controlling sensitive information?

A customer has requested a presentation on how the Microsoft 365 Compliance Centre can help improve their organisation's compliance posture. The presentation will need to cover Compliance Manager and compliance score. What is the difference between Compliance Manager and compliance score?
options: Compliance Manager is the regulator which manages your compliance activities. Compliance score is a calculation of the overall compliance posture across the organisation.

Compliance Manager is an end-to-end solution in Microsoft 365 Compliance Centre to enable admins to manage and track compliance activities. Compliance score is a calculation of the overall compliance posture across the organisation.

Compliance Manager is an end-to-end solution in Microsoft 365 Compliance Centre to enable admins to manage and track compliance activities. Compliance score is a score that the organisation receives from regulators for successful compliance.
correctAnswer: Compliance Manager is an end-to-end solution in Microsoft 365 Compliance Centre to enable admins to manage and track compliance activities. Compliance score is a calculation of the overall compliance posture across the organisation.

question: An organisation is moving their IT infrastructure to the cloud. They want to know how to create and implement business and technology strategies in a way that will help them succeed in the cloud. What guidance can they use to help them transition to the cloud?
options: They should use the Azure Cloud Succeed Framework
They should use Azure Policy for guidance on moving to the cloud
They should use the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for guidance on moving to the cloud
correctAnswer: They should use the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for guidance on moving to the cloud

question: The compliance team needs to perform more advanced, complex, and repetitive content search tasks. What can enable the team to do more complex search tasks?
options: Use the Microsoft 365 autocontent search client
Use the PowerShell scripts provided by Microsoft
Use the continuous eDiscovery autosearch client
correctAnswer: Use the PowerShell scripts provided by Microsoft

question: Azure Policy can be used to remediate issues that get detected via its compliance checks.
Azure Blueprints can be used to create Role assignments for an Azure Subscription.
Blueprints can be used to create Management Groups.
All users in an organisation have Microsoft 365 cloud identities. Which identity model applies?
Custom roles require an Azure AD Premium P1 or P2 license.
_______ provides a central location for managing information protection, information governance, and data loss prevention policies.
Which Microsoft 365 compliance centre feature can you use to identify all the documents on a Microsoft SharePoint Online site that contains a specific key word?
Which score measures an organisation's progress in completing actions that help reduce risks associated to data protection and regulatory standards?
options: Secure score in Azure Security Centre

question: What can you specify in Microsoft 365 sensitivity labels?
options: Which watermarks to add to files
How long files must be preserved

question: Sensitivity labels can be used to encrypt documents.
Sensitivity labels can add headers and footers to files.
Watermarks can be applied to emails.
You can use Advanced Audit in Microsoft 365 to view billing details.
You can use Advanced Audit in Microsoft 365 to view the contents of email messages.
Which of the following can be used to provide a secure score for the resources defined as a part of your Azure account?
Which of the following provides advanced and intelligent protection of Azure hybrid resources and workloads?
The security admin wants to protect Azure resources from DDoS attacks. Which Azure DDoS Protection tier will the admin use to target Azure Virtual Network resources?

An admin has turned on logging diagnostics for Application Gateway in the Diagnostics section. They must also make sure that the WAF log is selected and turned on. It was observed that the Web Application Firewall doesn't block incoming requests. What could be the reason for this?
options: It is operating in Detection mode
It is operating in Prevention mode
It is operating under a custom rule
correctAnswer: It is operating in Detection mode

question: Which of the following statements holds true with reference to Azure Storage Service Encryption?
options: It helps to protect data at rest by automatically encrypting before persisting it to Azure-managed disks, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Files, or Azure Queue Storage, and decrypts the data before retrieval
It helps you control your applications' secrets by keeping them in a single, central location and by providing secure access
It helps you encrypt Windows and Linux IaaS virtual machine disks
It helps protect Azure SQL Database and Azure Data Warehouse against the threat of malicious activity
correctAnswer: It helps to protect data at rest by automatically encrypting before persisting it to Azure-managed disks, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Files, or Azure Queue Storage, and decrypts the data before retrieval

question: Which of the following is not a characteristic of Azure Security Centre?
options: It scans your environment to detect unprotected web applications
It allows you to track diagnostic information, including WAF alerts and logs
It can recommend Application Gateway WAF to protect these vulnerable resources
It provides increased visibility into and control over the security of your Azure resources
correctAnswer: It allows you to track diagnostic information, including WAF alerts and logs

question: Compliance Manager provides _______ to help admins to quickly create assessments.
The _______ section of the solution catalog is used to show how an organisation can quickly find, investigate, and respond to compliance issues with relevant data.
Which of the following tools help to deliver intelligent, automated, and integrated security across an organisation's domain?
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is required for conditional access policies.
Conditional access policies can be used to block access to an application based on the location of the user.
Conditional access policies can be applied only to users who have Azure AD joined devices.
_______ enabled collaboration with business partners from external organisations such as suppliers, partners, and vendors. External users appear as guests in the directory.
All Azure AD license editions include the same features.
With Windows Hello for Business, a user's biometric data used for authentication is _______.
options: stored on a local device only
replicated to all the devices designed by the user
correctAnswer: stored on a local device only

question: In a hybrid identity model, what can you use to sync identities between Azure Active Directory and Azure AD Domain services?
You can use Advanced Audit in Microsoft 365 to identify when a user uses the search bar in Outlook on the web to search for items in a mailbox.
_______ is used to identify, hold, and export electronic information that might be used in an investigation.
You can add a resource lock to an Azure subscription.
You can add only one resource lock to an Azure resource.

A company has implemented Microsoft Defender for Endpoint built into Windows 10 and Microsoft's robust cloud service, to help enterprise networks prevent, detect, investigate, and respond to advanced threats. Which of the following is a feature of Endpoint behavioural sensors technology?
options: It ensures configuration settings are properly set and exploit mitigation techniques are applied
It collects and processes behavioural signals from the operating system and sends this sensor data to your private, isolated cloud instance of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
It generates alerts when they are observed in collected sensor data
Behavioural signals are translated into insights, detections, and recommended responses to advanced threats
explanation: It collects and processes behavioural signals from the operating system and sends this sensor data to your private, isolated cloud instance of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint

question: According to which of the following characteristics of the cloud can resources expand or contract as quickly as they are used or freed?
_______ provides recommended guidance that's intended to help organisations to align with data protection regulations and standards.
Which of the following types of DDoS attack flood the network with legitimate traffic, thereby overwhelming the available bandwidth?
Azure Sentinel provides intelligent security analytics across your enterprise. The data for this analysis is stored in _______.

Due to a certain regulation, your organisation must now keep hold of all documents in a specific SharePoint site that contains customer information for five years. How can this requirement be implemented?
Which tool can enable an organisation's development team to rapidly provision and run new resources, in a repeatable way that is in line with the organisation's compliance requirements?
A hold has been placed on content relevant to a case. How long can it take for a hold to take effect?
Azure Policy service can be used to check the compliance of existing resources.
Which edition of the Azure Active Directory gives you Privileged Identity Management to help discover, restrict, and monitor administrators?
An organisation has developed an app to allow users to be able to sign in with their Facebook, Google, or Twitter credentials. What type of authentication is being used?

Your company is planning on using Azure AD for the storage of identities. They want to make use of the self-service password reset feature. Which 3 of the following authentication methods are available for self-service password reset?
